holidays.name: Cranky Co-workers Day
holidays.description: A day to acknowledge and maybe humor those cranky colleagues who make office life more... interesting. Embrace the crank, but with a coffee and a smile!
holidays.origin: Originated from corporate culture humor circles, highlighting those notoriously grumpy people in the workplace.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that acknowledging a cranky co-worker‚Äôs feelings with humor can actually improve office morale.

holidays.name: Speak Up for Service Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to speak up about the quality of service they receive, promoting good customer service and accountability.
holidays.origin: Started by customer advocacy groups to empower consumers to voice their experiences.
holidays.funFact: This day has led to viral stories of customers who spoke up leading to positive changes in business practices.

holidays.name: International Internet Day
holidays.description: Celebrating the anniversary of the first electronic message sent over the ARPANET, the precursor to the internet.
holidays.origin: Marks the sending of the first message over ARPANET on October 27, 1969.
holidays.funFact: The first message sent over ARPANET was supposed to be 'LOGIN' but the system crashed after typing 'LO'.

holidays.name: National Pitbull Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and raise awareness for the lovable and often misunderstood Pitbull breed.
holidays.origin: Created by dog lovers and advocacy groups to promote positive images of Pitbulls.
holidays.funFact: Pitbulls were once considered America‚Äôs most popular dog breed in the late 1990s.
